option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"C:/Users/Vadim/PycharmProjects/PythonProject10":"{\"/handlers/commands.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`start`: Initializes the bot, adds the user to the database, and displays a menu of options.\\n\\n`help_command`: Provides a list of available commands and instructions for creating reminders.\\n\\n`set_tz_command`: Allows the user to set their timezone.\\n\\nThis file is responsible for handling the commands received by the Telegram bot, such as `/start`, `/help`, and `/settz`. It interacts with the database to manage user information and settings.\",\"/handlers/callback_handlers.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`callback_router`: This function handles the callback queries received from the Telegram bot, and performs different actions based on the data in the callback query.\\n\\nThe file `handlers/callback_handlers.py` is responsible for handling the callback queries received from the Telegram bot. It defines a function `callback_router` that processes the callback data and performs actions such as creating a new reminder, listing the existing reminders, or canceling a reminder.\",\"/utils.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`parse_user_datetime`: Attempts to parse an arbitrary user-input date/time string and returns a timezone-aware datetime in UTC.\\n\\n`format_local`: Converts a datetime in UTC to a local datetime in the specified timezone and formats it as a string.\\n\\nThe file also defines a `DEFAULT_TZ` constant, which is the default timezone to use if a user-provided timezone is not available.\",\"/db.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`init_db()`: Initializes the SQLite database with two tables: `users` and `reminders`.\\n\\n`add_user(tg_id: int, username: str | None, tz: str | None)`: Adds a new user to the `users` table, or ignores the insertion if the user already exists.\\n\\n`set_user_tz(tg_id: int, tz: str)`: Updates the timezone (tz) of an existing user in the `users` table.\\n\\n`add_reminder(tg_id: int, text: str, remind_at_iso_utc: str, repeat: str | None \\u003d None)`: Adds a new reminder to the `reminders` table.\\n\\n`get_due_reminders(now_iso_utc: str) -\\u003e List[Tuple]`: Retrieves a list of reminders that are due (active and have a reminder time less than or equal to the provided time).\\n\\n`mark_reminder_inactive(rem_id: int)`: Marks a reminder as inactive in the `reminders` table.\\n\\n`update_reminder_next(rem_id: int, next_iso_utc: str)`: Updates the reminder time for a specific reminder in the `reminders` table.\\n\\nThis file provides a set of functions to interact with a SQLite database for managing users and reminders.\",\"/render.yaml\":\"This file appears to be a configuration file for a Telegram reminder bot, and it does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it defines the services and environment variables for the bot. Here\\u0027s a summary:\\n\\n`services`: This section defines the configuration for the Telegram reminder bot, including the type (web), name, environment (Python), build settings, build and start commands, auto-deployment, and environment variables.\\n\\n`envVars`: This section defines the environment variables for the bot, including the Telegram bot token (`TG_TOKEN`) and the check interval (`CHECK_INTERVAL`) for the bot.\",\"/env.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is a configuration file that loads environment variables using the `dotenv` library. The file sets two variables:\\n\\n`TOKEN`: The Telegram bot token, which is retrieved from the environment variable `7948578566:AAGZzyXFx4vgmAZTsRELno1heKLK--B1OhY`.\\n\\n`CHECK_INTERVAL`: The interval in seconds for checking the bot\\u0027s status, which is retrieved from the environment variable `CHECK_INTERVAL` with a default value of `60`.\",\"/README.md\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It appears to be a simple document with a title \\\"My-Telegram-bot\\\" repeated twice. The file does not provide any additional information about the purpose or functionality of the \\\"My-Telegram-bot\\\" project.\",\"/handlers/reminders.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`text_handler`: This function handles text messages from users, allowing them to create reminders by providing a date/time and a message, or by using the format \\\"напомни: через 2 часа | Текст\\\".\\n\\nThe file `handlers/reminders.py` is responsible for handling user interactions related to reminders, such as creating new reminders and canceling existing ones.\",\"/bot.py\":\"This file is a Python script that implements a Telegram bot. It uses the `python-telegram-bot` library to handle user interactions and set up a background job to check for due reminders and send them to users. The file does not contain any classes, but it has the following functions:\\n\\n`job_check_reminders`: A function that checks for due reminders in the database and sends them to the corresponding users.\\n\\n`delete_webhook_sync`: A function that synchronously deletes the Telegram bot\\u0027s webhook.\\n\\n`main`: The main function that sets up the Telegram bot, registers the handlers, and starts the bot\\u0027s polling loop.\\n\\nThe file also imports various modules and sets up logging and environment variables. It checks the Python version to ensure compatibility with the `python-telegram-bot` library and initializes the database connection.\"}"}
